intro: Pseudomertensia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered pseudomertensia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swamps. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat.
